feed.title: Penter Lab
feed.subtitle: Understanding cancer and immune cell interactions using large-scale single cell genomics approaches.

entry.title: Publication: Coevolution of mitochondrial and somatic nuclear DNA mutations.

link.title: Publication: Coevolution of mitochondrial and somatic nuclear DNA mutations.

entry.content:
A satisfying conclusion to a side-story that became a major project of Livius’ postdoc with Cathy Wu.

[no title info]
[no author info]
[no publisher info]   ·   [no date info]   ·   [no id info]

We show co-evolution of mitochondrial and somatic nuclear DNA mutations using various approaches including reanalysis of bulk RNA and WES-seq data, single cell DNA sequencing and ASAP-seq. Further, we use maternal mitochondrial DNA variants to track rare donor or recipient-derived single cells following allogeneic stem cell transplantation to map out microchimeric states, such as residual leukemia at incipient relapse or remaining donor-derived hematopoiesis at time of frank hematologic recurrence.
entry.summary: A satisfying conclusion to a side-story that became a major project of Livius’ postdoc with Cathy Wu.

entry.title: Seunghoon starting!
entry.content:
Seunghoon Kim, PhD has started his work as shared postdoctoral research fellow between Dr. med. Jana Ihlow and Prof. Sandrine Sander. We are happy to provide the scientific environment in which he will develop his single cell genomics research projects.

Best of luck to you Seunghoon!
entry.summary: Seunghoon Kim, PhD has started his work as shared postdoctoral research fellow between Dr. med. Jana Ihlow and Prof. Sandrine Sander. We are happy to provide the scientific environment in which he will develop his single cell genomics research projects.

entry.title: Mischa starting!
entry.content:
Dr. Mischa Selig has started his work as postdoctoral research fellow with us - we are very thrilled to have him and wish him all the best of luck for his projects.

Bring it on, Mischa!
entry.summary: Dr. Mischa Selig has started his work as postdoctoral research fellow with us - we are very thrilled to have him and wish him all the best of luck for his projects.

entry.title: PhD position available!
entry.content:
We have an opening for a PhD position.

Please consider applying! :)
entry.summary: We have an opening for a PhD position.

entry.title: first Penter lab publication!
entry.content:
Exciting times - the first publication from the Penter lab has been released in which we review current studies that employ single cell genomics for performing immune monitoring in blood malignancies.

Hope you will enjoy this read! :)

Single-cell genomics-based immune and disease monitoring in blood malignancies
Anja C. Rathgeber, Leif S. Ludwig, Livius Penter
Clinical Hematology International   ·   14 Jun 2024   ·   doi:10.46989/001c.117961
Single-cell genomics-based immune and disease monitoring in blood malignancies
single cell genomics immune monitoring clonal evolution review
entry.summary: Exciting times - the first publication from the Penter lab has been released in which we review current studies that employ single cell genomics for performing immune monitoring in blood malignancies.

entry.title: Funding from DKMS
entry.content:
We are grateful for funding from the DKMS John Hansen Research Grant, which we will utilize to track the beginnings of AML relapse after allogeneic stem cell transplantation.

Thank you for a wonderful award ceremony in Glasgow.

Photographs
entry.summary: We are grateful for funding from the DKMS John Hansen Research Grant, which we will utilize to track the beginnings of AML relapse after allogeneic stem cell transplantation.

entry.title: Welcome Jonas
entry.content: Welcome Jonas in our lab. Jonas will utilize long-read sequencing and single cell genomics to identify novel immunotherapeutic targets in AML. Good luck!
entry.summary: Welcome Jonas in our lab. Jonas will utilize long-read sequencing and single cell genomics to identify novel immunotherapeutic targets in AML. Good luck!

entry.title: Welcome Angelos
entry.content: Welcome Angelos in our lab. Angelos will work on single cell genomics approaches to understand clonal evolution and changes in transcriptional profile.
entry.summary: Welcome Angelos in our lab. Angelos will work on single cell genomics approaches to understand clonal evolution and changes in transcriptional profile.

Please consider applying! :)

entry.title: nanoranger released!
entry.content:
The new year is starting with great news - nanoranger is seeing the light of day!

Integrative genotyping of cancer and immune phenotypes by long-read sequencing
Livius Penter, Mehdi Borji, Adi Nagler, Haoxiang Lyu, Wesley S. Lu, ..., Jerome Ritz, Robert J. Soiffer, Jacqueline S. Garcia, Kenneth J. Livak, Catherine J. Wu
Nature Communications   ·   02 Jan 2024   ·   doi:10.1038/s41467-023-44137-7
Targeted genotyping of scRNA-seq cDNA libraries using long-read sequencing with Oxford Nanopore
nanoranger scRNA-seq targeted genotyping long-read sequencing ONT

This is an approach to perform targeted genotyping of single cell RNA sequencing cDNA using Oxford Nanopore.
entry.summary: The new year is starting with great news - nanoranger is seeing the light of day!
